item.description:
What better way to bring in the holiday season than a Christmas Eve discussion of Gotthold Ephriam Lessing (1729-1781) and his short essay The Education of the Human Race (Die Erziehung des Menschengeschlechts).

Lessing, a dominant figure of the German Enlightenment, lays out his most direct argument for religious tolerance in his essay The Education of Humankind. This was a theme he was to revisit often, most famously, in his well-known drama Nathan the Wise.
